instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330B: What is 820-3330B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.D6990: What is D6990? Diode sitting between PPBUS_G3H/PP18V5 charger voltage and PP3V42_G3H power supply input, can die and cause PP3V42_G3H to be missing and have no input voltage. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.R6990: What is R6990? Resistor between charger voltage and input to PP3V42_G3H power supply on Macbooks from around the year 2012. This resistor blows when C6990 has shorted to ground or U6990 has shorted to ground, and will result in PP3V42_G3H missing and the magsafe charger not having a light since PP3V42_G3H is necessary for the SMC to turn on and the onewire circuit to turn on..

threads.title: Macbook Pro 15" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no green or orange light
threads.message: I have a macbook pro 15" laptop that has no power there is no green or amber light, what are the signs of bad smc chip?

threads.title: Macbook Pro 15" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no green or orange light
threads.message: Known good magsafe? Voltage on PP3V42?? Voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>??

threads.title: Macbook Pro 15" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no green or orange light
threads.message: Magsafe is working I tried it on know good laptops, no pp3v42, no voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>

threads.title: Macbook Pro 15" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no green or orange light
threads.message:
PP3V42 fist then....

Diode mode on L6995??
Voltage on <DIODE>D6990</DIODE> pin 3??

threads.title: Macbook Pro 15" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no green or orange light
threads.message:
I find it common for IRF9395TRPBF to blow on this. It will cause the charger to see no load and as a result output no voltage. 

1) What is <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>?
2) What voltage is on pin 1 and 2 of <RESISTOR>R6990</RESISTOR> with charger plugged in?
3) What voltage is on pin 2 and 3 of <DIODE>D6990</DIODE> with charger plugged in?
4) IF voltage is high on pin 2 of <DIODE>D6990</DIODE> but low on pin 3 of <DIODE>D6990</DIODE>, what is the resistance to ground on pin 3 of <DIODE>D6990</DIODE>? Make this measurement without power plugged in. 
5) IF voltage is low on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>, around 0.2v, is there a short circuit to ground on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>? If not, replace IRF9395TRPBF/<TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>.
